greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of color patterns (set partitions) in an unoriented row of length n using k or fewer colors (subsets).
comment: Two color patterns are equivalent if the colors are permuted.
In an unoriented row, chiral pairs are counted as one.

T(n,k) = Pi_k(P_n) which is the number of non-equivalent partitions of the path on n vertices, with at most k parts. Two partitions P1 and P2 of a graph G are said to be equivalent if there is a nontrivial automorphism of G which maps P1 onto P2. - _Mohammad Hadi Shekarriz_, Aug 21 2019
link: B. Ahmadi, F. Alinaghipour and M. H. Shekarriz, Number of Distinguishing Colorings and Partitions, arXiv:1910.12102 [math.CO], 2019.
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=1..k} (S2(n,j) + Ach(n,j))/2, where S2 is the Stirling subset number A008277 and Ach(n,k) = [n>=0 & n<2 & n==k] + [n>1]*(k*Ach(n-2,k) + Ach(n-2,k-1) + Ach(n-2,k-2)).
example: For T(4,3)=10, the patterns are AAAA, AABB, ABAB, ABBA, ABBC, ABCA, AAAB, AABA, AABC, ABAC, the last four being chiral with partners ABBB, ABAA, ABCC, and ABCB.
mathematica: Ach[n_, k_] := Ach[n, k] = If[n<2, Boole[n==k && n>=0], k Ach[n-2,k] + Ach[n-2,k-1] + Ach[n-2,k-2]] (* A304972 *)
xref: As k increases, columns converge to A103293(n+1).
Cf. transpose of A278984 (oriented), A320751 (chiral), A305749 (achiral).
results.author: _Robert A. Russell_, Oct 27 2018
